alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 11 at 12:27PM MDT until May 14 at 8:00AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .Light rain and scattered rain showers still possible over this area with half an inch to an inch still possible on the already saturated ground with the previous rainfall thus far. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following areas, Bighorn Mountains Southeast, Northeast Johnson County and Southeast Johnson County. * WHEN...Through early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
